description.originalText: Amanda is a super sweet, reliable and patient caregiver. She takes care of my baby boy since he was 4 months old and does really well with meeting all his needs. We're very happy we found her!

description.displayText: We interviewed Amanda and she seemed like a great fit for our family.  Unfortunately her reference did not check out.  The vague answers the reference gave us didn't match up with what Amanda told us about her work experience.  A quick social media and Google search of the reference name and phone number made it clear that the reference was Amanda's friend (who does not have kids).  When we asked Amanda about it she said she had just been offered another position and was no longer interested in working with us.

description.displayText: Canceled her Monday morning work appointment on Sunday 6 pm.
description.originalText: Canceled her Monday morning work appointment on Sunday 6 pm.

description.displayText: Amanda was an amazing Nanny and addition to our family for two years. When I first hired her, I thought I was just getting essentially a babysitter but my two kids (10 months and 3 years old ) got a second mother when I couldn't be around. I can never express enough how much her help meant to me. She would get them ready in the mornings, give them breakfast (usually we discussed meals in advance and she was very accommodating), take them on adventures or play dates, give them lunch and snacks, if I needed her to do a load of laundry occasionally she would handle it. She always cleaned the dishes she used for the kids, even without me asking. She was always laughing and playing with them. My three year old, L., was always eager for her to come over and read or play with them. She was always excited to have her friend Amanda come over and would talk about the fun times they shared long after she left. She bonded with them both and if we hadn't moved, we never would have let her go!
